title: Bring traffic to brick&mortar biz
description:
活用されていないブロックチェーンの価値

リアルな小売店に挑戦するEコマース

非効率なリワードプログラム

企業によるデータ搾取

f6_assessments.q0: Connecting customers and businesses and rewarding loyal customers is a great way to use custom tokens created on Cardano. It will cause more adoption and use of Cardano. Going global with this will create massive traffic. There is a huge community of businesses and clients that could benefit from this.
f6_assessments.q1: Already committed team, though it is hard to tell if this team really is a part of this project. Adding them on this proposal so voters and CAs can see the people involved with this project will boost voter confidence. Yes, they are in the white paper, but it's hard to tell if they are real people. I had to google them to make sure they are real. I still don't know if they all are really involved in this project except for Jade. You have a lot of online presence, but it's basically just copy and paste. The budget allocation and plan seems very far fetched and unpractical. Creating sub-items for each item listed that needs funding to explain what exactly needs to be funded will create clarity on how the funds will be spent.
f6_assessments.q2: They provided a roadmap with milestones, but no dates and no real key performance indicators. Only a possible launch date. So tracking the success of this proposal will be quite hard. They list a lot of problems and promises to solve them with little to no detail on how they will solve them. No real risks or challenges have been considered. Having the other members of your team directly involved with creating this plan would enable them to help identify future challenges and risks.

f6_assessments.q0: I agree that a dApp built on Cardano could be well positioned to disrupt traditional brick and mortar loyalty programs and in turn help drive traffic to these stores.  However, it isn't clear to me how this will be executed based on the content in this proposal.  Including additional information on platform and technology would be helpful.  Is this going to be a mobile app?  Will it integrate with existing POS platforms? Will it use geolocation?
f6_assessments.q1:
The technical partners seem strong, but it isn't clear who the team is behind this proposal.    The proposal states "Clanity puts the customer at the center of our rewards program to drive results by enabling technologies that enhance the customer experience, and offer value propositions that are financially incremental."  

1.) How is the customer placed in the center of the rewards program?
2.) What results are being driven?
3.) What types of technologies are going to be enabled that enhance the customer experience?
f6_assessments.q2: Proposal needs a definition of success and accompanying KPIs.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal does address the challenge and may well progress Cardano's mission, but it's in the presentation is where I question the efforts of the proposer him/herself. This proposal is written exactly the same as the website and no effort was made to rewrite it for a different audience. It is a pity as the proposer had been a CA in a previous funding round and should have been well aware of the strict requirements to enable assessors to properly vet a project. In addition, Clanity seems to be a project which aims to build on Cardano in tokenised form hence asking for funding to build its infrastructure as well as conducting a token sale seems to be double-dipping. Conventionally, projects secure funding from the token sale, so if Catalyst provides the funds instead, any amount raised and allocated to the team from the token sale purely becomes reward rather than payment for the services of building its infrastructure. This does not bode well and could be a pre-cursor to questionable tokenomics. I would suggest that this proposal is revisited for a later funding round, explain clearly the reasons why the funds are requested and clarify its impact on tokenomics due to a separate token sale. There is an upside to the presented project, however, it needs to be more Catalyst-centric so it can be properly assessed on its own merits.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has listed qualifications and past experiences but have failed to produce a link to a public profile where these credentials can be checked. I recommend a link to Linkedin.com or some other profiling site. Even the Clarity website does not provide information on individual team members with their bona fides and commonly for token-presentation sites where there is an intention to perform a token sale, who the team is, is of paramount importance as potential buyers often use this to validate whether the project and the token sale is legitimate or a scam.  The proposal describes the common trajectory of building a token-economy with timelines and roadmaps clearly presented, but it is missing the detailed information to provide confidence regarding how each of the identified amounts will be spent. I recommend that should this be re-submitted at a future funding round, that the proposer engages some of the partners identified which includes dev organisations, and secure a realistic dev costing and plan for inclusion.
f6_assessments.q2: A number of missing elements contribute to the low score for its auditability; verifiable profile of the proposer and the team, detailed costing for each build element (and there are quite a few developments in its inventory), timelines of when the token sale will occur and what its impact on any funding secured from Catalyst. There are a few notable partners mentioned on the proposal who also appear on the website and with Cardano Foundation and ATALA Prism specifically named, casts doubts as to its authenticity. If this proposal is resubmitted, it may well benefit to support those claims if a mention from Cardano or Atala to attest to this partnership in either an article, or from one of the partners' social channels. Given the scale of such a project and despite its suitability to this Challenge and to Cardano's mission, there's not enough of the foundational information to give an assessor confidence that success is achievable. Do the basics well and the rest will follow. I highly recommend rewriting this proposal for a Catalyst audience, present public credentials and secure reciprocating acknowledgements from Cardano Foundation & others of any existing partnerships. For the amount of funding being requested, these are the bare minimum requirements that could give such a project confidence.

f6_assessments.q0:
Introducing brick and mortar businesses to the blockchain is a perfect fit for this challenge. The real world commerce is still much larger than eCommerce  and providing a steamless interface for onboarding real world businesses into Cardano is an obvious next step for Cardano.

They also mention building a Token Swap dApp and wallet, as well as a data broker platform, utilizing the privacy and security of the Cardano blockchain to do it, voters should note that this proposal is a perfect fit for this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team's members were not listed although they did mention MLabs as a partner for the project, which is rather significant. On the website and video provided it is mentioned that they are selling a token, I am unsure of how or if that ties into this proposal as it was slated for mid 2021, which has already passed.

If we are to assume that they cancelled the token sale and determined that Catalyst was a better fit for funding, then voters should be conscious of the fact that team team may plan to sell a token in the future, presumably after the funds from a successful proposal have built the platform.
f6_assessments.q2: Although the roadmap is laid out in detail, the proposal did not specify specifically what the KPIs or targets would be for each. This will make it difficult for voters and project catalyst as a whole to determine the success of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Problem statement and solution do not match - the problem statement is raising several issues and the solutions is too vague to solve all these issues. Basically this proposal aims to recreate a rewards program website that offers several services for retail. If implemented, the program could attract retail customers.
f6_assessments.q1:
The described relevant experience of the proposer would match the challenge, including the partners that are named, here. I went to the website and found that they list Cardano under "partners and network". It would be important to specify if this proposer is partnered with Cardano and if so, how. Also, network and partner is misleading if it is just about a general network that the proposer sympathizes with or is part of as an individual but not with the company. I would expect this to be more transparent.
This here sounds unreasonable: "We will be reinventing the process of how businesses acquire new loyal customers. Clanity will offer efficient ways of targeting customers and effectively convert them into purchasing customers." Basically, what I am saying is - while the proposal raises interesting questions, sentences like the above do not provide actionable steps to solve the stated problem - they moreso seem like marketing phrases that could attract customers to acquire the services of the agency. While this might be good, further information would be needed to assess if this proposal would be likely to implement what it claims. Since this proposal requests the complete fund for this challenge, it would be important to give relevant problem statements and actionable steps including a roadmap with a timeline that would help understand why this project would be so valuable that it should be the only one to be funded in this round. While this might sound unfair, the proposers should be aware of the funding process, since this is a business model and business experts so it is important that basic value of what a company can realistically ask for, is understood.
f6_assessments.q2:
Auditability is difficult based on the information in the proposal. Relevant information is missing on basically all of the key measures:

    Number/growth of application output
    Number/growth of application transactions
    Total volume of Ada involved in application transactions
    Total/growth of resource usage by applications
    Number/growth of distinct addresses mentioned in application transactions
    If the application uses tokens:
    Number/growth of application tokens
    Number/growth of distinct addresses holding application tokens
The roadmap does not contain a timeline and ends with a "world summit". Seeing that we´re usually talking about a 12months timeline here, I find it highly unlikely that a world summit would be a realistic szenario for a new business. The financial plan is - as it is stated - not auditable, it is not allocated to certain

f6_assessments.q0: If fully realized, the project has the potential to increase usage of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The budget would exhaust all of the F6 funds fr DApps & Integration.   The budget is not broken down except at the highest milestone level.  The team and advisors have some but not all of the requisite experience to bring this to completion. Overall the proposal is at a very high level with a lot of high level goals but little detail.
f6_assessments.q2: The timeline is only at the highest level and goals are large.   Overall the proposal is at a very high level with a lot of high level goals but little detail.  The sheer magnitude of the project calls into question the ability to complete, even with a $250,000 budget.

f6_assessments.q0: This brings value to both sides of end users, the consumers and the retailers. It is something that people are used to doing and like doing, loyalty programs, and they've described a business model that incentivizes users to use their platform. It is interesting as a business development manager to see a model that we can engage with our customers while also having them perform marketing for the company as well. This could be pitched to use the marketing budget and have the marketing department bring in more revenue rather than spending revenue.
f6_assessments.q1: They have a well thought out plan and business model They have laid out a detailed plan and budget. They do not go over how they will overcome one of the biggest problems this market is facing, keeping that 50% of users active and engaged. I'm not sure that brick & mortars will be able to maintain an advantage over e-commerce busnesses if this platform is successful and they start using it too. They would have to implement more or favorable terms for brick & mortar including free onboarding, discounted services, and strategic advice along the way.
f6_assessments.q2: They give a detailed roadmap and lay out a plan for their budget. The roadmap does not contain any dates though, and they do not lay out examples of what success would look like at different stages.

solution:
過疎地にブロックチェーンを導入する

パートナーにトラフィックをもたらす

普遍的なリワードプログラムの変革

ユーザーが自分のデータを所有する
experience: 創業者、プロジェクト管理、リーダーシップ、投資の経験を持つ。シリコンバレーのアクセラレーター出身。  ブロックチェーンカウンシルメンバー、Fund5のCA
